item.description:
Who's Paul Dolman, you might ask?

He's an author, entrepreneur, musician, comedian and speaker who took refuge on Martha's Vineyard to heal from a painful breakup.  He hitchhiked around the island, and magic flowed in one delightful circumstance after another, including being picked up by Larry David, the creator of the Jerry Seinfeld show and Curb Your Enthusiasm, as well as other rich, famous and powerful people.  Hence, the title of his new book, Hitchhiking with Larry David, which Mark and I thoroughly enjoyed!

Mark and I went to the Vineyard this summer, and actually had a very similar experience with Paul. We bumped into him totally by surprise FOUR times!  (That's a picture of us taken with his phone when we bumped into each other in the library. So fun! We're all much better looking than that, btw. lol ) This happens to him all the time.  We ended up having dinner together and talking for hours, and can't wait to spend time with him again.  He is magical. AND YOU CAN BE, TOO!

How does this relate to the Law of Attraction? 

Because he's a perfect and FUN example of allowing your life to flow with ease and joy!  He and his story are about letting go of fear, following your inner voice, and opening your heart to the love, magic and mystery that permeate everything around you.

His first book, What Matters Most, is under development as a TV series, and this newest book is being considered for a movie.  And it all happened by just following his inspirations and having some fun.

An Opportunity for You:

Come hear his story and wisdom.  You'll laugh and learn, be inspired, and receive personal tips from a powerful attractor.

Members from the Boston Law of Attraction meetup who are co-organizing this event with us will be joining us, too! So reserve your seat now.

More Than Words is a used bookstore with a sweet cafe for desserts, teas and coffees. It's a nonprofit social enterprise that empowers youth who are in the foster care system, court involved, homeless, or out of school to take charge of their lives by taking charge of a business.  If you have any used books, CD's o r DVDs to donate, please bring them along!  It will be greatly appreciated.  Here are the guidelines: http://mtwyouth.org/book_donations/book_donation_guidelines/

Please be considerate of your hosts (that's me, Mark, Paul, Chew-Hoong, and the bookstore!), and honor your "yes" RSVP by either showing up or letting us know if your plans change by changing your RSVP. Many of you have been wonderful about this, and we very much appreciate your understanding, consideration and support! Thank you!

If you want to get a head start on enjoying the book, here's the Amazon link: Hitchhiking with Larry David.  Paul will be bringing books, as well.

Looking forward to enjoying this special event with you!

Ann and Mark

P.S. Moody Street is full of great restaurants and has simple parking.  Make a full night of it!
item.how_to_find_us: You'll see us in the back of the bookstore

group.name: "Good Vibrations" Metro West Law of Attraction Community

item.name: Inspirational guest speaker - book author, Paul Dolman!
